overview_metadata.overview_subtitle: Using Random Samples from Two Populations to Draw Inferences
overview_metadata.overview_description: In this lesson, students analyze and interpret data to make decisions or validate claims. They collect a random sample from provided data, create a dot plot, calculate the measures of center and spread, and interpret the data regarding radio listenership. Students also consider data related to cities' temperatures, interpret histograms and box-and-whisker plots related to gallery visits, and analyze rainfall data.

overview_item_data_items: I can compare the measures of variation for random samples from two populations.
I can use measures of variation to draw conclusions about two populations.
I can express the difference between the centers of two data distributions as a multiple of a measure of variability.
For some real-world problems, you need to compare the center and spread of two data sets.
To compare the center and spread of data sets, you can calculate the mean, median, MAD, and IQR.
You can identify information about the center and spread of data in dot plots, histograms, and box-and-whisker plots without making any calculations.
When two data sets have close centers and large spreads, the data sets are likely to overlap, reducing the confidence in a decision based on the data.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students briefly describe how two populations can be randomly selected for a sample.
Students use a random number generator to select samples for each population from provided data.
Students create a box-and-whisker plot displaying similar measures of center but different spreads.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Analyzing Displays of Data from Random Samples
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students compare the characteristics of two histograms.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Into Each Life Some Rain Must Fall!
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students calculate the appropriate measures of center and spread to make their conclusions.

overview_item_data_items: If facilitating this lesson without student devices, no additional materials are needed.
To avoid printing additional materials not included in MATHbook (like Activate activities and Session Quick Checks) project them using the Present button above.
